intro: Lisianthius elisabethae, commonly known as the Elizabeth's lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive, elongated shape that sets it apart from other members of the genus. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
